hotspots.name: Kaziranga National Park
hotspots.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its population of the Indian one-horned rhinoceros.

hotspots.name: Majuli Island
hotspots.description: The largest river island in the world, known for its vibrant culture, Satras, and lush landscapes.

hotspots.name: Tea Gardens of Assam
hotspots.description: Famous for producing Assam tea, these gardens offer scenic views and a glimpse into tea production.

hotspots.name: Kamakhya Temple
hotspots.description: A sacred Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Kamakhya, located on Nilachal Hill in Guwahati.

hotspots.name: Nameri National Park
hotspots.description: Known for its diverse flora and fauna, Nameri is a great destination for eco-tourism and trekking.

hotspots.name: Sivasagar
hotspots.description: Historical town famous for its Ahom palaces, temples, and the Sivasagar Tank.

hotspots.name: Umananda Island
hotspots.description: A small river island in the Brahmaputra River, home to the Umananda Temple and offering beautiful views.

hotspots.name: Manas National Park
hotspots.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its biodiversity and the presence of the golden langur.

hotspots.name: Guwahati Zoo
hotspots.description: One of the oldest zoos in India, featuring a variety of animal species and a beautiful park.

hotspots.name: Diphu
hotspots.description: A picturesque town in Karbi Anglong district, known for its natural beauty and cultural diversity.

hotspots.name: Hajo
hotspots.description: A historic town with religious significance for Hindus and Muslims, home to the Hayagriva Madhava Temple.

hotspots.name: Bihu Festival Grounds
hotspots.description: Locations across Assam where the famous Bihu festival is celebrated with traditional dance and music.

hotspots.name: Barpeta Satra
hotspots.description: A significant Vaishnavite monastery with rich cultural heritage and beautiful architecture.

hotspots.name: Kaziranga Orchid Park
hotspots.description: A unique park showcasing various species of orchids and providing insights into local flora.

hotspots.name: Chandubi Lake
hotspots.description: A serene lake surrounded by hills, perfect for picnics, boating, and enjoying nature.

hotspots.name: Sualkuchi
hotspots.description: Known as the silk village, famous for its traditional Assamese silk weaving.

hotspots.name: Tawang Hill
hotspots.description: Offers panoramic views and is a great spot for trekking and nature walks.

hotspots.name: Jorhat
hotspots.description: Known for its tea estates and the historical site of the Jorhat Gymkhana Club.

hotspots.name: Pobitora Wildlife Sanctuary
hotspots.description: A smaller sanctuary compared to Kaziranga, but famous for its high density of rhinoceros.

hotspots.name: Silchar
hotspots.description: Known for its scenic beauty, Silchar is situated along the banks of the Barak River.

hotspots.name: Dibru Saikhowa National Park
hotspots.description: A biodiversity hotspot famous for its unique ecosystems and the white-winged wood duck.
